intro: Demorchis isabelensis, commonly known as Isabel's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It is characterized by its striking violet and white flowers, which bloom during the dry season. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in photosynthesis. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
